title: Whenever I watch another region's games, it really makes me appreciate Phreak

replies.body: I get the opposite feeling myself. I prefer casters who don't feel the need to make jokes all the time and can just talk about the game/let funny stuff happen naturally. Phreak brings a lot of awkward stops to the flow of commentary sometimes.
But the other casters, especially the EU ones, sound so uninterested in the game itself. Phreak actually sounds like he enjoys the game of League of Legends.

> [{quoted}](name=Laughing Fish,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=keOt3ZJT,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-03-07T15:48:36.844+0000)
>
> But the other casters, especially the EU ones, sound so uninterested in the game itself. Phreak actually sounds like he enjoys the game of League of Legends.

The impression I get is that Phreak is less a fan of the game itself and more a fan of the culture surrounding it, which is why he makes so many jokes. I think he loves casting, probably more than most commentators, but I wouldn't say he's more passionate about the game. At least, I've never watched EU LCS and thought that they sounded bored or uninterested.

It might be that I have low standards for sounding interested and it's definitely that I just don't really have the sense of humour that a lot of the community has (Twitch comment stream is a mess to me), but I generally disagree with people whenever they complain about non-Phreak casters!

I think the top four casters, that are the most passionate about the game, are Jatt, Deficio, Monte, and Kreppo.  It is obvious they put a lot of hard work into the knowledge that they present into their casts.  Phreak is still my favorite, because I really enjoy his humor, and his play by play actually gets me more into the game than I usually would have.  He gets really into it.  I also want to make it clear that I think Phreak is very knowledgeable of the game, but I'm sorry the four I listed know more.
THE QUAAAAAAAAA(voicecrack)AAAAAAAADRRAAA killll!

Jatts annoying and Deficio is bland as fuck. Also, of course the analysts appear to know more, Phreak's a play-by-play caster, its' not his job to be smart about the game. That being said, he's a Diamond 1 ADC

Some fair points. Phreak is certainly a big fan of the culture, possibly more than he is a fan of the game itself. The problem I have with the EU casters is that they sound almost robotic. They are hyper focused on the game, which has its advantages (from what I have seen the EU casters are better at keeping track of things like flash timers), but it can be harder to pay attention to them during slow parts of the game. If all 10 players are just farming, I would prefer the casters to make some jokes and talk about the game as a whole, rather then go into great detail of last hitting. Obviously this is personal preference, but that is the primary reason I prefer Phreak. To me he understands that at the end of the day, League of Legends (even professional league) is a *game*. 

Also, the Twitch comment stream *is* a mess.

i watch all NA, a bit of EU (origen/fnatic/sometimes UOL) and LCK (ROX/SKT) 

i like casters in all these regions, but when the teams are focused on farming, i wish i could just mute them all and hear the game sounds

Frankly, i think Phreak does the perfect job. I mean, if theres anything more boring than watching someone play a game/sport, its watching them do it while someone talks monotone saying "Another tower dive for Dignitas, didnt see that one coming." 

Honestly i wish if there was less fear of some commentary that was comedic such as "Oh baby a triple!" or other twitch like memes. The little outbursts and jokes such as the curse of Dyrus coming up every once in a while are what makes LCS watchable for most people. Even if EU and LCK is more competitive, its just so damn boring that after i watch the pick/ban phase, i go do something else.

> [{quoted}](name=MotherTeresa1910,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=keOt3ZJT,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-07T16:49:55.731+0000)
>
> (Twitch comment stream is a mess to me)

No, it's not about having the same sense of humour of everyone else. It's just outright a mess.
I only enjoy Monte and DoA. Watching LCK for awhile and then trying to switch back to LCS is like eating steak for a month and then having to eat McDonald's again. Goes for both casters and gameplay.
Monte and DoA are legit the only reason I watch competitive League. I love those guys.

They have control, it feels both smooth but interested, scripted but original... not every minute is a burn fest and they actually CAST the team fights instead of squabbling, ***looking at you worlds***  which something i really appreciate about them

This is the reason Riv is my favorite caster, when he casts, you get the impression he literally loves casting as well as loves the game. He brings so much energy and hype to the table, that I prefer to listen to him cast over pretty much any other caster.
he also brings so little knowledge lol
That's not his job; He does play-by-play. He is always backed-up by either kobe or Jatt to provide analysis.
I disagree. Quickshot is actually amazing, IMO, (not as good as Phreak, because Phreak is Phreak, but he's not bad at all)

> [{quoted}](name=Laughing Fish,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=keOt3ZJT,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-03-07T15:48:36.844+0000)
>
> But the other casters, especially the EU ones, sound so uninterested in the game itself. Phreak actually sounds like he enjoys the game of League of Legends.

Phreak really likes the game.
Same. I don't like Phreak pretty much at all, but the LCS target audience is probably a little younger than me, so I get why he's popular.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dyTEnb5GiRo

just gonna leave this here

I think it's just that the EU casters have a dryer sense of humor overall and aren't as in your face with their jokes as Phreak is.

And it's fine if you prefer the latter but you're mistaken if you think the EU guys are without passion:

https://youtu.be/CgFR9Pn7OH4

They certainly have passion, but Phreak's charisma and love of all things League makes him the top caster imo. However, it could also just be a matter of being used to the American style of casting, as I don't normally like European sports casters either.

Phreak and Kobe are prolly my favorite two in the NA. Some of the things they say just make me laugh. 

I like Krepo and Quickshot from Eu, Krepo has some of the funniest puns/sayings.
phreak awkward moments is the best thing about the LCS, games are boring now anyway, i wont get impressed when fiora 1v3 and xPeke an inhibitor riot, it happens in silver too....
That first gif is probably the best thing in life.
The QUAAAAAADRA kill for huni...
I miss deman and Joe Miller :( they were amazing
Banannnas,
Agreed, my two favorite casters.

Didn't Deman cast at IEM?
This guy is/was a GOD at commentating.
This is just as true today as it was 6 months ago. https://67.media.tumblr.com/tumblr_m9liurunM71rdarzao1_500.gif

I only watch EU LCS mainly because of the casters.
And also because I get to hear brit-inspired globish instead of american english. Northeastern europe OP.
phreak is a truly truly outrageous gem of lcs casters.

One of these days, I'd love to see phreak come out in a superman t-shirt. Then when the other commentators ask, he could reply "hey, I'm super-phreak, super-phreak, I'm super-phreakey". Doing that would make my day, even though it'd have nothing to do with anything. {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

How can you not like Phreak after he slowly crept his face into the camera shot when asking Reignover what team could beat Immortals? Frankly thats my favorite moment in all of LCS this season so far.
My favorite casters are Rivington and Quickshot. But I like worlds because then I can get a dose of phreak in there too.

I think Doa deserves a spot in a top casters list, both because he's really funny and because he has the unenviable job of stopping Monte from being too much of a sour-puss.

That said, a three-man caster team of Phreak, Doa, and Kreppo could be pretty funny to hear if only for how long it took for the first two's jokes to overwhelm Kreppo.

(Because being Kreppo is suffering.)

hearing kreppo, the german (?) one and some guy that seemed to be kreppo's relative casting in IEM was so boring, and all the ads, that repeatable song and the 2 min pause between picking champs and getting into the game just made it worse
if you want to laugh... phreak is your man. if you want good commentary on the gameplay... phreak is 100% not your man.
